meanings.definition: To subscribe to more of something than is available or necessary.
meanings.sent1: I always oversubscribe to magazines and end up with too many to read.
meanings.sent2: She tends to oversubscribe to events and then has to cancel last minute.
meanings.sent3: My friend loves to oversubscribe to food delivery services, but her fridge is always full!
meanings.sent4: The teacher warned us not to oversubscribe to extracurricular activities and burn out.
meanings.sent5: I learned the hard way not to oversubscribe to online courses and overwhelm myself.

meanings.definition: To allocate more shares in a company than are available for purchase.
meanings.sent1: Investors may oversubscribe to popular IPOs, causing the stock price to soar.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to oversubscribe the shares to create more demand in the market.
meanings.sent3: The shareholders jokingly threatened to oversubscribe to the meeting snacks.
meanings.sent4: The CEO warned against oversubscribing shares and diluting the value for existing investors.
meanings.sent5: The decision to oversubscribe the new stock offering was met with mixed reactions from analysts.
